result.execSummary:
The defendant Marko B Nikcevich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Must register as a Sex Offender. No Contact with any minors - to Exclude family members. No electronic devices that have access to the internet. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marko B Nikcevich in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Klein makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: any minors - to exclude family members 
____Must register as a sex offender
____No electronic devices that have access to the inernet
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence by 5:00 p.m. on 4/22/17 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on April 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Marko B Nikcevich in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Parties request a sentencing date.   Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   Defendant Marko B Nikcevich did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein explains on the record why Defendant was not able to appear today.  Court waives Defendant's appearance for today. Previous court dates set remain on.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marko B Nikcevich in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
